Reviews.Content: The WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. My husband and I are frequent travelers as a perk of our employment. We have visited Amsterdam several times and try to stay in different locations each time. For this last trip, we wanted to stay near Central station for the convenience of easily getting from place to place within minutes. This hotel is definitely near the station but not worth the $500 for a three night stay. Here are the numerous reasons as to why I would NEVER suggest this hotel to my colleagues, friends, or family: The only entrance and exit to the reception and to your room is through the restaurant. The hotel states on its site that it is recently renovated. I can't imagine what it looked like before it was renovated because I was not impressed at all. There are cracks and stains all over the walls. The wash closet/bathroom was only a bit bigger than one you find on an airplane. The shower stall was missing a door and no matter how you shifted the shower head, water got all over. The new, spare toilet paper roll that you always get was used and wrinkled from obviously getting wet at some earlier point. (You decide how it got wet in the first place.) The dingy bed had a head board that was actually just a free-standing piece of board that moved away from the bed if you press your pillow against it even softly. Here is the icing on the cake: on our first night there, we went out to dinner and did some walking around to enjoy the sights. Upon arriving back to the hotel, we decided to stop and have a hot drink and maybe some dessert in the restaurant as it was unusually cold outside. The manager asked us if we had decided what to eat and we said we were going to have just drinks and dessert. He could not hide the disgust in his face. The waiter came over and we ordered our drinks. When we tried to order dessert, the manager calls the waiter and says something to him. The waiter comes back to us, leans down close and says Listen. My manager is a (insert expletive). He says you can not order dessert if you do not order dinner. Sorry, he's a _______. Take your time and enjoy your drinks. Well, needless to say, we were very annoyed with this. The manager comes over and we tell him how terrible the service is. He interrupts and proceeds to tell us that it is not terrible service but we are taking space from others who may want to order dinner. (There were plenty of empty tables.) My husband says that we are guests of the hotel and we have every right to order what we want. The manage back tracks and says he didn't know we were guests. He then says he'll deliver the dessert and what did we order. Although I didn't want the dessert anymore at that point, my husband allowed him to bring it. The manager then came over later to offer us free drinks on him. This didn't change things with me. This is the rudest service we have ever had here or in any other country we have visited. My advice, spend your money and stay elsewhere!
Reviews.Author: wine4us

Reviews.Content: Should be Shut Down! One word describes this hotel, DISGUSTING!. The room was filthy, smelled, and the linen was dirty. The pictures they show on their website is a complete fabrication. The rooms look nothing like what is on the site. And the worst part was me, my wife, and 10 month old son were sleeping and awoke to the sound of 2 mice running around the room trying to get into the trash cans and our luggage. When we informed the front desk, they just shrugged their shoulders and said it was from the construction across the street, not a care in the world. And YES, the reception desk is also the front desk at a resturant. You are walking between people while they are attempting to eat with your baggage and family just to get to your room (if you want to call it a room), PLEASE take my advice, take your family elsewhere when you go to Amsterdam, this place is UNSAT, UNSAFE, and UNCLEAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: eurodevil

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Terrible Do not stay at this hotel, no matter how cheap it may be! We spent one night at this hotel and it was the worst experience of my life. The rooms are tiny, smelly and covered in damp, the shower wasn't much better, in fact we couldn't even bear to use it! Also we had to put the duvet on the bed ourselves and when we done so we discovered it was covered in stains, disgusting. There is constant noise outside. The hotel reception is in the middle of a restaurant and we had to walk through the restaurant dragging out bags bumping into the diners on the way. The only good thing about the hotel is the location but that would not entice me to stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Katienana

Reviews.Content: Seriously misrepresented in the photos We booked this hotel through Easyjet before we discovered tripadvisor-what a mistake. The pictures are probably from 2 rooms that we happened to walk past accidentally. Our room was dirty, freezing and had no redeeming qualities. We had no problems at the reception, but it always seemed someone new was arguing with them when we walked past. Don't make the mistake we did, do the research. This was a good location, but that's about it. I'm sure there are other hotels for better prices in the same location.
Reviews.Author: elisha333

Reviews.Content: great location, but basic rooms first things first.... this hotel is right in the centre of Amsterdam... excellent location.. on the demark strip... 5minz from central station, 2 minz from McDonalds, next to a few good barz and restrant and right in the heart of the red light district. but with all that comes noise... not that is bothered us but you are on a main busy road so expect noise in the morning, night and the day...lol... we booked a tipple room and when we arrived at 12.20pm we were giving are key straight away... 2minz later i was back at reception demanding another room... this room was not fit for animals never mind humans... and what do you no??? The receptionist wasn鈥檛 even surprised, they just gave me a different room straight away, they new the state of the room they had put us in!!!! the room we were given next was ok.. was reasonable sized but still no sofa bed as described??? (2 singles and a double sofa bed) just 3 singles!!! i have to say tho.. if i had been giving this room at the start i would of been happy!! it had a great big bay window looking right over the main strip, a tv with English channels and a safe. Overall this hotel is ok and i would stay there again, after visiting Amsterdam 5 times you realize that the closer you get to the centre the more you pay and the less the quality!!! Feel free to ask me any questions. xxx
Reviews.Author: me.xxx

Reviews.Content: Great hotel I was in this hotel two times, just for single night each time.Location is just great, 5 minutes from central station and very close to all atractions. Rooms are small but Amsterdam is really city where you don't spend so much time in the room.Stuff is very young and nice. Rooms are clean and bathrooms clean and new. Electronic room safe included in price, TV small but works good.
Reviews.Author: Frenki

Reviews.Content: Very Excellent Location This Hotel is near the Central Station, just minutes walk. Short distance from Red Light District. Good English Breakfast. The toilet is clean and staff is very hospitable. (Regin Lagaac - Cambridge UK)
Reviews.Author: reginlagaac

Reviews.Content: Basic, what do you expect? You can't expect quality when you pay 拢35 a night, but this hotel wasfine. Not the cleanest place i've ever stayed, and the steep stairs are a nightmare but you get this everywhere in amsterdam. The double bed was actually just two singles put together, but for the price youcan't argue. The shower was nice and clean, the room was plenty big enough, and the staff were helpfull. Not great, but really not bad for a cheap hotel. I would be tempted to pay a bit extra next time though.
Reviews.Author: fakiehalfcabflip

Reviews.Content: Good Triple, terrible Twin!! Stayed here in a group of 5 in one triple and one twin room.The triple room was actually quite nice - was v.worried after reading all these reviews! Room was spacious, no bed bugs(!), large windows to let air in, cleaned daily. All in all a decent room.Seeing the twin room, however, I began to understand the bad reviews! I felt so sorry for the 2 people staying in it! It was absolutaly tiny! Barely big enough for 2 people and more like a single room.Reception is in the hotel restuarent which is a bit wierd but ok as its 24 hour so you can get in at any time.Breakfast was disapointing and we only had it on one day. Suggest you go elsewhere.The area is ok, its not the best part of amsterdam by any means but as a base it's fine and very near the train station which is handy for getting to the airport.Staff were friendly, couldnt really fault them. All in all the hotel was fine, not great but fine for a base to explore the city. Would recomend the triple room, not the twin! Managed a sneaky look at a double room when it was being cleaned out and that looked ok too.
Reviews.Author: Student123

Reviews.Content: No Problems hi i was really worried after i booked this hotel before reading the reviews however they were all unfounded. I arrived about lunch time and was checked in easily my single room was on the second floor and was basic but clean and tidy, with clean towels and bedding i did check the room as i was still a bit worried however all was ok. The staff were very friendly and took time to stop and chat. the only noise i heard was from other guests on the stairs and doors closing. Breakfast was fine the only problem i had was with the small coffee cups (i like a big drink with my food) all in all if you are looking for a central basic place to stay this is fine
Reviews.Author: jaybeeScotland

Reviews.Content: Congealed brown goo and cigarette burns We could ignore the cigarette burn through our bed cover however the congealed brown (chocolate?) stains next to it were simply nauseating. We then found cigarette butts down the back of the bed. (Honestly!) Perhaps the soiled black carpet as we headed up the stairs should have prepared us for the utter traversty of a room this hotel dares to charge 120 Euros a night for. We requested a clean cover which never came and were treated with disdain by a receptionist clearly more interested in the text message he was sending than our humble requests. The mints available by reception in a dirty old Dutch clog accurately sum up the appalling standard of hygeine and lack of cleanliness in this awful place. If the dirty facilities in your room aren't enough to send you running, you will no doubt bash your toe on the raised bathroom floor, scald yourself in the tiny shower which drastically changes temperature of its own volition - or be kept up by street light filtering through where the curtain falls short of the length of the window! Like all tourist traps, being in an ever popular location allows this hotel to offer the barest of service and incredibly low standards at an appallingly inflated price. Do not stay here.
Reviews.Author: LondonJen

Reviews.Content: Dark, dirty, cramped..awful! This hotel really is terrible. The room was tiny and cramped, there was no wardrobe, and one electricity socket situated behind the chest of drawers, so every time we needed to use it we had to move the chest of drawers out of the way!! We were put at the very top of the building, with one window facing a brick wall. The shower was absolutely tiny with a low sloped ceiling so you had to crouch to use it. Only good thing is the location, ideal on the Damrak. For the price, it really is not worth it.
Reviews.Author: lattelinz

Reviews.Content: oh my god what a dump !!! this poor excuse for a hotel has got to take the prize for the worst hotel in the world. The room that they allocated to my husband and I was a tiny and grotty with 2 single beds squeezed into it (even though I had pacifficaly asked for a double bed when I booked) The carpet as other people had mentioned in their reveiw was FILTHY. We also found the enterance through the restaurant grotty and a bit intimidating. Hotel staff were also unhelpful and miserable. The only good point about this place was it's location it is in an ideal place to get to see amsterdam. As for the hotel itself I would never stay there again in a million years not even if I was paid!!!
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolBabe

Reviews.Content: No where near as bad as expected!!!! After reading the vast majority of the hotels reviews i was honestly crapping myself as i thought we were going 2 go 2 a right dump. As soon as we got there early morning (10 am) We greeted and were able 2 leave our luggage as to not waste anytime as it was not time for check in. After our quick check in we went up 2 the room dreading what we were going to. Suprisingly there was a large spacious room with laminate floor and clean white bedding. The only minor issue was the beds - they were 2 singles pushed together - but i ws told to expect this from may hotels in the area. The bathroom was clean and towels were changed daily and bedding every other day. We were staying on the first floor and we couldn't hear much from downstairs - only banging of doors on the same floor as us. Breakfast was set out every morning with meats, cereals, cheese, rolls and juices which were all really nice. The staff were really friendly and made an effort to say hello and chat etc. We stayed here for 6 nights and had no problems - anything we asked or needed was sorted straight away. For the location and price we would definatley stay again. Infact we are planning another trip to amsterdam and will defo stay here. For a young couple it is ideal!
Reviews.Author: Chops_88

Reviews.Content: Not for Us! Stayed at this hotel after a friend booked it for us.Was very wary after reading the reviews,and it was everything we expected apart from the bedding was very clean and the bed was comfy.The room was very tiny and it is a grotty dirty hotel.The staff were lovely, but that could have been because we were part of a large group so they had made a lot of money from us.We wanted to move to another hotel after the first night but didnt want to fall out with the others so we reluctantly stayed.We will never return to this hotel and would gladly have payed for another hotel just to escape the depressing excuse of a room.Would not recommend to anyone!
Reviews.Author: BJML

Reviews.Content: wasnt that bad we booked this hotel for four nights from 12th oct till 16th oct.we booked it then read the reviews afterwards and needless to say we were crapping ourselves wondering what we were in for in the hotel. everywhere else was booked up when we tried to book another hotel before we left for amsterdam so it was just tough luck we had no choice but to stay there. on arriving we had no problems checking into the hotel. we were given room 63 on the sixth floor. when we got to the room door i was terrified of what the rooms were to be like according to all the bad reviews i was expecting something totally stinking, i closed my eyes and got my husband to walk in first lol and i just heard him say its ok. there was a wooden floor in the room so none of the dirty carpet that others were saying and the carpet on the stairs wasnt that bad considering people r running up n down it all day. the room was clean with very clean sheets and white towels, the view wasnt great from the window but who cares you dont wana spend your time in amsterdam looking out your hotel window. i have only one bad thing to say about the place and that was the smell in the en suite, yuk! it was fine at certain points in the day but for some reason really late at night and first thing on a morning it stunk of what i could only describe as a sewer smell it really was disgusting but there wasnt anything we could do about it so we just kept the windows open all of the time. the cleaners came in every day and made the bed etc. the breakfast was a buffet breakfast where you helped yourself you had the choice of fresh apple juice or orange juice then on platters there were slices of cheese and ham and salami and then a basket of fresh baps so you could make a sandwich etcalso you had a choice of two different types of cereal and it wasnt that bad. the staff werent too bad they smiled and acknowledged us whenever we walked in the place but they were always very busy. so all in all our stay was no where near as bad as some of the reviews i have read on here so if youre anything like me and have booked this hotel then read the reviews afterwards and are now panicking about staying there then honestly dont be. oh and one last thing, as for the noise from guests or the front desk, i know we were on the sixth floor but we never heard a thing, and even when u walked by the front desk or through the restaurant it was never noisy.
Reviews.Author: bubblegum-31

Reviews.Content: Want to be bitten? Want to be bitten really bad?I have just returned home after my worst stay ever with blistering bites all over my arms, face, and body. The hotel has filthy carpet everywhere, very cheap, nasty food for breakfast and the clatter of a very loud kitchen and guests up and down the staircase keeps you awake all night. To get in, you have to enter the restaurant and bar, somewhat scary for a woman traveling alone. Only some of the young waitresses were very nice and sympathetic .I only booked this hotel because I had trouble to find a hotel in the overbooked Damrak area while in a 4 day training there. As it happened the only decently priced flight went a day earlier and not having been to Amsterdam before I thought I would enjoy sightseeing. Little did I know that horrors were round the corner. As I was booked already for the 3 nights I e-mailed the hotel to contact me if I could come 1 day earlier. They called, confirmed verbally a one day earlier arrival. When I arrived a found myself without a room late Sat. afternoon in a booked out city. They had me wait for nearly 3 hrs, pretending to help and the hotel manager refused all responsibility. He told me to go back to the airport at my expense of course if I wanted to stay at a room for less than a 150 EU.In the end the Tourist office at the Central Station helped out, but it was a costly experience in time and money by the time I was sorted. Never again!!!!!
Reviews.Author: hypschool

Reviews.Content: Staff very cheeky  we booked this hotel as our other hotel had double booked us. The rooms were stinking. The carpets were filthy, the smell of the rooms was disgusting, curtains were hanging of the rail 's + were filthy, says there is safe in your room no safe, the breakfast was even worse, the staff were very unfriendly + cheeky. we payed 拢50 a night each to stay in this dirty hotel it's not worth 拢10 a nite each. dont stay here it's not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: dont waste your money the only thing this hotel has going for it is its location our pre paid room was down graded and nothing was done to fix the problem or to refund our money,it was dirty and our sheets weren't changed all week,the service was non existent it was even a major task just to get into the room half the time,oh and not that it bothered us much but if you want any peace anytime of day or night forget it
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: If you value your life and your possesions dont stay here. This hotel has no regard for fire safety, there are no fire doors between floors or fire escapes and the fire alarm will be turned off if smoke from the kitchen triggers it.I had valuables stolen from my room, most likely by staff and I arrived to find the room I booked had been given away. The alternative room I was provided with was very noisy and eventually I had to move to another hotel, check out Hotel Luxer it was worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: GlennAMaddy

Reviews.Content: Rat running in the room in the night This is the worst hotel I've ever experienced. I didn't get what I've paid for. Room is poorly furnished. Bathroom disgustingly smelled. TV remained out of use although I've informed the front desk to change. In the night it was even much awful, a rat was running in the room. Noisy construnction lasted until midnight which made it impossible to sleep. Supply for breakfast was poor too. Waitresses were in rude manner. For the first time, I was asked by the hotel to pay the room charge as soon as I've checked in.Hard to believe it names itself a 3-star hotel.My recommendation: DO NOT CHOOSE this HOTEL!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Robbed while we were sleeping by staff!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! My boyfriend and I were robbed while we were sleeping by a staff member. They stole money, credit cards and a cell phone. The management did nothing to help us and the police department in Amsterdam is a joke - they made us sign a report in Dutch that we didn't understand and we wasted an entire day filling out reports and explaining what happened. Aside from being robbed - the hotel was GROSS! No towels in the room, the bathroom smelled, the sheets were dirty and there was a dead mouse outside our door when we came back after dinner one night.Too top that off, I was getting dressed and heard someone at the door trying to come in and I yelled 3 times not to come in and the staff member walked right in while I was half dressed 鈥?he did not care or apologize. The food there is terrible and we went for the 鈥渇ree鈥?breakfast that only 4 people were there for and they ran out of spoons when all they had was cereal and rotten cheese selections. Every night we were there - they were doing construction right outside our window till about 4am, then at 7am a group of band members played drums outside the hotel. All in all - it was a horrendous experience that I would not wish on my worst enemy! Do yourself a favor and spend a little more money and stay somewhere else that is safe and clean - I wish we did!- highly disappointed Boston couple鈥?/p>
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disgusting I had a filthy room, the carpet was engrained with dirt, the shower cubicle was cracked and unhygienic, there were scuffs on walls, cigarette burn-hole on chair, thoroughly sordid. I asked for a change of room but the second was equally bad. Pay a few euros more, go somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The worst hotel i have ever been in. The worst hotel i have ever been in.The service is awful, the rooms are dirty.Don't expect to sleep because the front desk will keep you awake.Oh, and one last thing, the breakfast is a bad for your helth.Run for your life.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No probelms whatsoever!! After reading terrible reviews about this hotel, I was slightly apprehensive to say the least! Me, my partner and my 12 year old son stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in June 05. Check-in was quick and painless, I was dreading this after some of the reviews. We were in room 25 which was a triple room. The room was big, basic, very clean and had everything we needed. Our room window opened up on to the back of another building, this wasn't a problem for any of us as we were there to enjoy the city, not spend all day looking out of the window!The hotel is above a steak house, although we didn't eat there, the food looked and smelt lovely. Continental breakfast was included, which was cold meats, cheese, bread rolls, cereals and fruit juice. This was nice, plentiful and well presented. You could have an English breakfast for 5.50 Euro's if you preferred. The day we were leaving, our flight was later in the afternoon. We checked out at 11am and were allowed to leave our cases behind the reception at no extra cost.All the staff were friendly and we didn't encounter any problems whatsoever. For the price I paid for this hotel, the central location and the service we recieved, I would definitely book to stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: avoid this "hotel" avoid this hotel at all costs arrived having booked through late rooms (useless) only to be told the 2 rooms we had booked had been given away to someone else they offered us a apartment in an even dogier part of the city which could only be described as a squat.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Got to love the lift! Well, what can I say. It was an experience. We should have payed attention when the lift said no more that 300kg as four people and their luggage managed to get us stuck in the lift for about 20 minutes!All in all though, it was good. There was 6 of us (between 20 and 23) and we did have a good time. Bathroom was spacious and the beds were comfy so we couldn't complain. We managed to break one bed during a wrestling match which they were cool about and we turned up most mornings at about 4-5 out of it and they were always helpful.The breakfast in the mornings was very basic but for about 10 euros you could get a full english and if you asked, normally they would give you free beer. The waiters were great help as they knew all the best spots to go and its right on the Damrak so it was about 2-4 minutes away from the RLD and about 5 minutes from Central station!Added with the fact that it was a cheap hotel to stay in and the restaurant downstairs giving 10% discount to people staying there, we would go back again! Remember though, its not the sort of hotel you stay in when ur planning to spend a lot of time in the hotel. A bed, bathroom, bar and beer. I give it an excellent, you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ecellant hotel, well recommended We stayed at the hotel de korenaer from the 17th of november 2004 - the 20th of november 2004, and them 3 nights in the hotel were excellant. The staff are very friendly and will help u with any problems you come across. The rooms are all modern decorated and very clean and cosy. our room was no. 27 which was a triple room and had a balcony with an extraudinry views of the damrak and right opposite 'Vans Beurs Berlage'. The hotel itself was situated in an excellant place it was just 2 minutes walk from central station, 3 minutes walk to the dam square, and about 1 minute walk into the famous red light districe. In the hotel price you get your breakfast included which was 7-10am and was fairly decent considerin you dont pay major 拢拢拢拢拢拢 for the hotel, it was just cereal and continental stuff.The hotel also had a restaurant and served lovely food for a cheap price, and the hotel has 24 hour security so u come back to your room in the early hours of the mornin.Also the cleaner (Jamile) was a top notch guy, he used to come to our room and have a little joint with us and was very helpful and polite.So if anyone asked me if they shud stay in the hotel de korenaer i would say, yes deffinately, it was excellant valur for money, excellant service, excellant staff and in an excellant position.Have a nice timeAarronBennettGav
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not safe for kids! I enjoyed my stay in Amsterdam - no so my wife whose perception was immediately and irrevocably tarnished by the dirty carpet in the room. OK thats a typical bird for you, but I would say that this was the least enjoyable leg of our half term tour round W Europe.First of all do not repeat do not drive to this part of Amsterdam - the trafiic is 1mph hell. Secondly, although the staff seemed friendly, especially the waitresses paid great attention to our kids, this is a place for adults. There are potentially fatal safety hazards for kids here - perhaps worst of all, an 3 foot open panel six inches off the ground, which leads out to a 50 foot drop onto solid concrete. We never felt comfortable in our room which had double doors leading out onto....nothing - and we were thrity feet up on the second floor.The food however was very good and the waitresses very nice.
Reviews.Author: Bristolcitytillidie

Reviews.Content: Best avoided. Stayed at this place several times in the 1980's. Then it was owned and run by a nice Dutchman named Jan. It was Ok as we normally got the rooms in the new part of the hotel. Those in the original were small, dark and porrly maintained.In the early 1990's it was sold and the next time I went found it to be staff by North Africans or similar. I couldnt believe it was the same hotel. The stairs were blocked off and the door nailed shut. Was given one of the old rooms, despite booking one of the new ones. They would not accept any Plastic and insisted on cash. As it was late I had'nt got enough.Dont worry they said we have a money exchange desk. Their rates were the best you could possibly get ..FOR THEM.plus a hefty commission. Had to stay that night but left Quickly after breakfast, which by the way was terrible as well.
Reviews.Author: geoffboxer

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and sometimes get more ! I'm not sure what happened to the previous two reviewers when they stayed at this hotel but our experience was very different. We found the accomodation and staff to be excellent value for money. Given that we booked the hotel in August, during school holidays, we found it to be excellent for the price paid. We checked in early and the staff took our details and allowed us to leave our bags until the room was ready. The staff were very pleasant throughout our three night stay. Regarding the previous reveiwers comment we did see cereal laid out the night before but it was well covered and certainly not a health risk. We ate in the hotel and the food was basic but fine. The room itself did look onto the damrak on the 1st floor, it was small, clean and the noise levels bearable considering you are in the centre of town (which has its own advantages). The only problem we had was that we found the room to be too warm. Overall, I would far rather pay the price for a small but comfortable hotel than pay over the odds for a swanky hotel room that you don't get value for money from. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay Away from Living Hell!!! Take some good advice: Book a Hotel very early or you'll end up being ripped off to stay in a dump. This hotel was unbelieveable - It is a health hazard let alone a mess, light fittings were hanging from the ceilings, there were halls in the walls in the corridors, the room was disgusting, a piece of the step into the bathroom was missing, the TV didn't work and the staff were unhelpful to say the least. Check in was meant to be 12.30 but we had to wait until 2, Check out was 11 but the door was banging at 10.30. When we came back one night - about 12ish the breakfast was already out for the next day - uncovered too!! The lift was dodgey, I got stuck in it for about 10 minutes it was going up and down like a yo yo!! It may sound funny but this is all true!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beware-this hotel is a dump!! This Hotel is a 1st class dump situated on Damrak, which is a very busy street day and night. It is run by a rather dubious lot who will do anything and employ any trick to get your money. The rooms are delapidated , damaged and scruffy. Lights do not work and the TV has little by way of reception. The rooms overlooking Damrak are impossible to get a decent nights sleep in as none have double glassing, in fact paper had been stuffed in the gaps by previous occupants.All in all only it is a very bad place to stay. So if your going to Amsterdam the motto is BOOK EARLY in a nice hotel which you will get for the price that this dump charges.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Suffisant pour dormir mais pas plus   showReview(19635475, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Service beim...   showReview(19998070, 'full');

Reviews.Content: extremement d茅莽u   showReview(16601597, 'full');

Reviews.Content: L'hotel si trova in un ottima...   showReview(16732424, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Comodo al centro citt脿   showReview(15563088, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: e' un hotel confortevole e i ragazzi che ci lavorano molto simpatici e disponibili   showReview(15563087, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Tr猫s bon h么tel pour budget moyen   showReview(15563089, 'full');

Reviews.Content: sympa mais un peu limite au niveau du confort et de la propret茅   showReview(15563086, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Accueil execrable   showReview(15563084, 'full');
